Is there any reason why people shoudl bother docking now, when they can just attach ship to ship with claw? Does using claw on ship have some downsides?

I'm guessing that the claw will mass more than a docking port. Also, if alignment is important, like during orbital assembly, the docking ports are better.

If this is true it might save me hours of cussing at my screen trying to get a maneuver setup, only to be told it is a full orbit away .

That shouldn't be a problem any more with the addition of the "next orbit" and "previous orbit" buttons.

Is there any reason why people shoudl bother docking now, when they can just attach ship to ship with claw? Does using claw on ship have some downsides?

Well, for one thing, docking ports look better on stuff like space stations and large spacecraft.

Also, the claw won't be unlocked until late in the tech tree.

Also in Pleborian's video he got a pretty circular orbit and there was NO shakieness to the AN/PN markers at all.

Now THAT, that is wonderful news! It seems that setting up transfers will only cause slight hair greying, instead of full loss like in the days of old

On the other hand, I was really hoping for a 3.75m capsule with crew capacity of 5 or 6. Maybe next time...
This is .18 all over again!!! Seriously, this update is just full of surprises! Time-warping in the tracking station? Flags on ships? New SRBs? This update is awesome.

I find it hilarious that some people thought that this was going to be a rushed or low-quality update!

The parts look great and asteroids are going to be tons of fun.

The new claw:

http://www.kerbalspaceprogram.de/wcf/images/photos/photo-3920-d0eb5004.jpg

Holy Kraken, that thing is cool. And what is the animation going to look like, I wonder? Because that looks like a "Deployed" mode.

Yes the Claw has a pivot! And you can toggle it off and on!

When you grapple yourself onto the asteroid, the asteroid counts as a part of your ship and is named this. So if you want to name an asteroid, you'd nee to attach a probe to it and name the probe what you want the asteroid to be called.

The asteroids I think come in a good range of size from barely movable to wackjob amounts of fuel needed
